verbs.description: President Donald Trump [V: has] granted Canada , Mexico , and the European Union a 30-day extension to existing exemptions on steel and aluminum tariffs . In addition , the U.S. has granted Australia , Argentina , and Brazil permanent exemptions from the tariffs . South Korea had already been given a permanent exemption to the steel tariffs ( but not aluminum ) as part of a separate trade deal with that country . The prior exemptions that Trump had given to Canada , Mexico , and the E.U. were set to expire at 12:01 a.m. ET on Tuesday . Reuters cited sources that said that no additional extension would be granted if a trade deal was not signed before this 30-day period runs out . Wait ... what tariffs ? On March 1 , Trump announced that the United States would be slapping a 25 percent tariff on all steel imports , and a 10 percent tariff on all aluminum imports . This announcement was met with opposition both by nations hit with the tariffs , …

Reuters cited sources that said that no additional extension would be granted if a trade deal was not signed before this 30-day period runs out . Wait ... what tariffs ? On March 1 , Trump announced that the United States would be slapping a 25 percent tariff on all steel imports , and a 10 percent tariff on all aluminum imports . This announcement was met with opposition both by nations hit with the tariffs , …
